properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 10 at 2:13PM CST until January 12 at 12:00AM CST by NWS La Crosse WI
properties.description:
...A Couple Rounds of Accumulating Snow Tonight Through Saturday
Night...

.A couple rounds of snow expected to impact parts of the area
tonight through Saturday night. The first round is expected from
this evening through Saturday morning across parts of northeast
Iowa into southwest Wisconsin. Snow accumulations of 2 to 4
inches are expected, with locally higher amounts possible. In
addition, there will be the potential for some light icing across
parts of far southwest Wisconsin.

After a short break Saturday morning, a second round of
accumulating snowfall is expected from Saturday afternoon into
Saturday night, with an additional 2 to 4 inches of snow over
parts of southwest into central Wisconsin. This will bring total
snow accumulations from tonight through Saturday night of 4 to 8
inches.

If you have any travel plans tonight through the weekend, please
stay up to date on the latest forecast information.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches
from tonight through Saturday night.

* WHERE...Vernon and Crawford Counties.

* WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to midnight CST Saturday night.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO MIDNIGHT CST SATURDAY NIGHT
